
```{r}
# load packages
library(data.table)
library(ggplot2)
```

## Demonstrate landscape

```{r}
l = ecoevomove2::get_test_landscape(
    nItems = 450,
    landsize = 30,
    nClusters = 30,
    clusterSpread = 0.5,
    regen_time = 100
)

ggplot(l)+
    geom_point(
        aes(
            x, y
        )
    )
```

## Random movement

```{r}
# run scenarios
data_random <- lapply(seq(20), function(x) {
  ecoevomove2::model_case_2(
    scenario = 0,
    landsize = 30,
    nItems = 450,
    clusterSpread = 0.5,
    nClusters = 30,
    regen_time = 100,
    tmax = 400,
    handling_time = 5,
    popsize = 200,
    genmax = 1,
    dispersal = 10,
    range_perception = 1.0,
    mProb = 0.01,
    mSize = 0.01,
    nThreads = 1
  )
})

sapply(data_random, class)
```

```{r}
# examine intake in random movement
data_random_intake = lapply(data_random, slot, "trait_data")

# assign replicate
data_random_intake = Map(
    data_random_intake, seq(length(data_random_intake)),
    f = function(df, n) {
        setDT(df)
        df[, replicate := as.factor(n)][]
    }
)

data_random_intake = rbindlist(data_random_intake)

# save trait data
fwrite(
    data_random_intake,
    file = "inst/data/data_traits_random.csv"
)
```

```{r}
# data plot
ggplot(data_random_intake)+
    geom_jitter(
        aes(moved, assoc, col = replicate)
    )

ggplot(data_random_intake)+
    geom_histogram(
        aes(
            moved
        )
    )
```
